Rich Historical Heritage

From a sleepy hamlet to the Queen of Hills - A journey through time

The Early Days

In the early 19th century, a patrol of the East India Company exploring access to Sikkim discovered a sleepy hamlet atop a thickly wooded ridge with a brilliant view of Mt. Kangchendzonga. The British soul, yearning for cold and rain, instantly recognized a 'hill station'.

Frontier Town Era

In the 1840s & '50s, Darjeeling became a haven for international misfits - Tibetan & East European refugees, fleeing Russians, displaced monarchs like the Emir of Afghanistan, and spies of every persuasion from British to Japanese, all drawn to this political compost shrouded in high mists.

The Name's Origin

The name is believed to be a corruption of Dorje-ling, literally the 'land of the mystic thunderbolt' from Indo-Tibetan Buddhist mythology. However, the Earl of Ronaldshay claimed it came from Lama Dorje-rinzing, founder of the monastery on Observatory Hill.

Since 1817

6 Days Darjeeling ‚Äì Kalimpong Tour Itinerary

Detailed sightseeing plan covering Darjeeling, Kurseong, Kalimpong & Mirik.

Day 1 ‚Äì Arrival & Darjeeling Transfer

Receive at NJP / IXB / Tenzing Norgay Bus Stand. Transfer to Darjeeling (6750 ft), known as the Queen of the Hills. Scenic drive through tea gardens with Himalayan views. Check-in at hotel. Evening free at Mall Road. Dinner & Overnight stay at Darjeeling.

Day 4 ‚Äì Kurseong / Toy Train

Visit Kurseong attractions including Eagle‚Äôs Craig, Dow Hills, Makaibari Tea Estate. Optional Toy Train Ride (subject to availability). Dinner & Overnight at Darjeeling.

Day 2 ‚Äì Tiger Hill & City Tour

Early morning visit to Tiger Hill for sunrise view. En-route visit Ghoom Monastery & Batasia Loop. After breakfast, city tour including HMI, Zoo, Ropeway, Tea Estate, Japanese Temple, Tibetan Refugee Centre & more. Dinner & Overnight at Darjeeling.

Day 5 ‚Äì Kalimpong Transfer / South Sikkim (Optional)

Transfer to Kalimpong. Visit Durpin Monastery, Deolo Hill, Morgan House etc. OR Optional South Sikkim tour (Char Dham, Temi Tea Garden, Namchi ‚Äì extra charge). Dinner & Overnight at Kalimpong.

Day 3 ‚Äì Scenic Local Sightseeing

Full day tour covering Ghoom, Lepchajagat, Lamahatta, Teen Chuley, Lover‚Äôs View Point, and Tea Estates. Return by evening. Dinner & Overnight at Darjeeling.

Day 6 ‚Äì Mirik & Departure

After breakfast check-out. Visit Mirik, Gopal Dhara View Point, Pashupati Market (Nepal border). Drop at NJP / IXB before 6 PM. Tour ends with beautiful memories.
